extends java.net.MulticastSocket

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSocket

        public AbstractSocket(byte userType,
              byte socketType,
              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> topics,
              int port,
              java.net.InetAddress multicastIp)
               throws java.io.IOException
        AbstractSocket constructor.
        Parameters:
        userType - User type (publisher, subscriber) read from properties.
        socketType - Socket type read from properties.
        topics - Topic list read from properties.
        port - Listening port read from properties.
        multicastIp - Multicast IP read from properties.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an exception occurs calling super constructor, or joining multicast.

      • AbstractSocket

        public AbstractSocket(Configuration configuration)
               throws java.io.IOException
        AbstractSocket constructor, receiving the configuratoin object instead of all the properties one by one.
        Parameters:
        configuration - The configuration object with the properties read from properties file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an exception occurs calling super constructor, or joining multicast.

    • Method Detail

      • isSubscribedToTopic

        protected boolean isSubscribedToTopic(int topic)
        Checks if the provided topic is in the list of subscribed topics, to avoid sending/receiving packets belonging to topics that the user is not subscribed to.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to check the subscription.
        Returns:
        True if it the provided topic is in the subscription topic list; false if it is not.

      • sendData

        public abstract void sendData(int topic,
            byte[] data)
                       throws NotSubscribedToTopicException,
                              java.io.IOException
        Publishes the given data for the given topic.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic the data will be published for.
        data - The data to send.
        Throws:
        NotSubscribedToTopicException
        java.io.IOException

      • receiveData

        public abstract byte[] receiveData(int topic)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        The data received for the subscribed topics.
        Returns:
        The byte array with recived data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
